title: Multi-region Data Replication
description: Create a AWS Lambda Function to consume streams from Amazon DynamoDB and replicate the data to another region.

introBox.headline: How it works
text: The terraform template deploys a Lambda function, two DynamoDB in different regions, and the minimum IAM resources required to run the application.
When items are written or updated or deleted in the table in first region (e.g. us-east-1),

the changes are sent to a stream. This pattern configures a Lambda function to poll this stream. When the function is invoked, it retrieves data from the payload containing the contents of the table item that has been written or updated or deleted in the table in the first region, then it makes changes in the table of the second region (e.g. us-west-2) based on the event type.
See the GitHub repo for detailed testing instructions.
